questions.question: Even though ......................... my children were born in Mumbai, ......................... of them speaks Marathi.
He has three daughters but .............................. of them lives with him.
questions.description: Either and neither are used to talk about two people or things Use none for more than two.

questions.question: In a football game, ........................... team has 11 players.
questions.description: Each is used to talk about  2 or more. Every is used to talk about 3 or more.

questions.question: .............................. three girls are intelligent and hard working.
.......................... my father and my mother were there at my graduation ceremony.
questions.description: Neither should be followed by a singular verb both should be followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: There was ............................. room on the bus, so we got off.
He hasn't got .......................... a brother or a sister.
questions.description: Neither means the same as not neither. We can also write 'He has got neither a brother nor a sister.'

questions.question: They were .............................. rich nor poor.
questions.description: Neither means not this nor that.

questions.question: ........................... of these answers is correct.
questions.description: Both should be followed by a plural verb.

questions.question: ………………………. them were there.
questions.description: Use both of before a pronoun.
